tit.j: 山口俊雄プロダクション

sen.j: 山口俊雄プロダクション（やまぐちとしお-、1928年6月 設立 - 8月 解散）は、かつて京都に存在した映画会社である。
sen.e: Yamaguchi Toshio Production (established in June 1928 and dissolved in August) is a film company which existed in Kyoto.
Yamaguchi Toshio Productions (established in June 1928 and dissolved in August) was a film company located in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: Production > Productions; fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: Yamaguchi Toshio Productions (established in June 1928 and dissolved in August) was a film company located in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 松竹系の新派劇の俳優で、マキノ・プロダクションとの提携作で主演した山口俊雄 (新派俳優)が設立したスタープロダクションであり、貸しスタジオの双ヶ丘撮影所で1本のサイレント映画を製作した。
sen.e: It was a star production established by Toshio YAMAGUCHI, an actor belonging to Shinpa-Geki (a New-School Play) in Shochiku family who had acted in movies produced in conjunction with Makino Production, and it produced one silent movie in Narabigaoka Studio, a studio for rent.

It was established by Toshio YAMAGUCHI, an actor that belonged to Shinpa-Geki (a New-School Play) in the Shochiku family who acted in films produced in conjunction with Makino Productions; it produced one silent movie by renting Narabigaoka Studio.
sen.cmt: eliminated "star production" as this term does not carry meaning in English; fixed grammar
sen.e: It was established by Toshio YAMAGUCHI, an actor that belonged to Shinpa-Geki (a New-School Play) in the Shochiku family who acted in films produced in conjunction with Makino Productions; it produced one silent movie by renting Narabigaoka Studio.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）3月、山口の所属する新派劇団「新潮座」と牧野省三率いるマキノ・プロダクションが提携して、山口の主演映画を2本撮ったのをきっかけに、同年4月、山口は「新潮座」を脱退してに単独で入社した。
sen.e: In March 1928, "Shinchoza," a drama group of new school where YAMAGUCHI belonged and Makino Production, which was led by Shozo MAKINO, partnered to shoot two movies featuring YAMAGUCHI, which caused YAMAGUCHI to leave "Shinchoza" and join Makino Production by himself in April.

In March of 1928, triggered by being featured in two films while he was in the new school drama group called "Shinchoza" that was partnering with Shozo MAKINO's Makino Productions, YAMAGUCHI left the group on his own and joined Makino Productions in April.
sen.cmt: added "of" after "March"; rearranged sentence and fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: In March of 1928, triggered by being featured in two films while he was in the new school drama group called 'Shinchoza' that was partnering with Shozo MAKINO's Makino Productions, YAMAGUCHI left the group on his own and joined Makino Productions in April.
sen.cmt: " "を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: そのころ、マキノの四国ブロック配給を行っていた三共社の山崎徳次郎は、阪東妻三郎プロダクションの経営者・立花良介と謀り、神戸市の菊水キネマ商会の大島菊松ら全国150館の独立系映画館主に呼びかけ、大阪に「日本活動常設館館主連盟映画配給本社」を設立、独立プロダクションへの製作費の出資と作品の直接公開の方針を打ち出した。
sen.e: About that time Tokujiro YAMAZAKI of Sankyo Company, which distributed Makino's movies in the Shikoku block, conspired with Ryosuke TACHIBANA, the top executive of Bando Tsumasaburo Production, to ask one hundred and fifty independent theater owners throughout Japan including Kikumatsu OSHIMA of Kikusui Kinema Firm in Kobe City to cooperate in establishment of "Nihon Katsudo Josetsukan Kanshu Renmei Eiga Haikyu Honsha" (Headquarters of Eiga Haikyu for association of masters of movie theaters in Japan) in Osaka and declared their policy of direct release of movies as well as funding for production cost of independent productions.

At about that time, Tokujiro YAMAZAKI of Sankyo, which distributed Makino's movies in the Shikoku area, conspired with Ryosuke TACHIBANA, the top executive of Bando Tsumasaburo Productions, to ask 150 independent theater owners throughout Japan, including Kikumatsu OSHIMA of Kikusui Kinema in Kobe, to cooperate in establishing "Nihon Katsudo Josetsukan Kanshu Renmei Eiga Haikyu Honsha" (Distribution Company Headquarters for Movie Theater Owners in Japan) (also known as "Kanshu Renmei" [the Theater Owner's Association]) in Osaka and declaring policies on directly releasing movies and funding for production costs of independent productions.
sen.cmt: Sankyo Company > Sankyo; one hundred and fifty > 150; fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: At about that time, Tokujiro YAMAZAKI of Sankyo, which distributed Makino's movies in the Shikoku area, conspired with Ryosuke TACHIBANA, the top executive of Bando Tsumasaburo Productions, to ask 150 independent theater owners throughout Japan, including Kikumatsu OSHIMA of Kikusui Kinema in Kobe, to cooperate in establishing 'Nihon Katsudo Josetsukan Kanshu Renmei Eiga Haikyu Honsha' (Distribution Company Headquarters for Movie Theater Owners in Japan) (also known as "Kanshu Renmei" [the Theater Owner's Association]) in Osaka and declaring policies on directly releasing movies and funding for production costs of independent productions.
sen.cmt: 原文「」の部分を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: それを受けた片岡千恵蔵は4月にマキノを退社、5月に「片岡千恵蔵プロダクション」（千恵プロ）を設立、同時期にマキノを退社した嵐寛寿郎、中根龍太郎、市川小文治、山本礼三郎らもそれぞれプロダクションを設立する。
sen.e: In conjunction with this establishment, Chiezo KATAOKA left Makino in April and established Kataoka Chiezo Production (Chie Pro) in May, and Kanjuro ARASHI, Ryutaro NAKANE, Kobunji ICHIKAWA and Reizaburo YAMAMOTO, who left Makino at the same time with him, also established their own productions.

In conjunction with this establishment, Chiezo KATAOKA left Makino in April and established Kataoka Chiezo Productions (Chie Pro) in May, while Kanjuro ARASHI, Ryutaro NAKANE, Kobunji ICHIKAWA and Reizaburo YAMAMOTO, who left Makino at the same time also established their own productions.

sen.cmt: 原文「」の部分を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: そこで山口もマキノを退社、同年6月、山口が設立したのがこの「山口俊雄プロダクション」（山口プロ）である。
sen.e: Thus YAMAGUCHI also left Makino and established this "Yamagauchi Toshio Production"(Yamaguchi Pro) in June, 1928.
This led to YAMAGUCHI leaving Makino as well, and he established "Yamaguchi Toshio Productions" (Yamaguchi Pro) in June of 1928.

sen.e: This led to YAMAGUCHI leaving Makino as well, and he established 'Yamaguchi Toshio Productions' (Yamaguchi Pro) in June of 1928.

sen.j: また、山崎の呼びかけに共鳴したマキノの大道具主任河合広始と撮影技師の田中十三もマキノを退社、京都・双ヶ丘に貸しスタジオ「日本キネマ撮影所」（双ヶ丘撮影所）を設立した。
sen.e: Furthermore, Hiroshi KAWAI, chief stage setting engineer of Makino, and Juzo TANAKA, a cameraman, also left Makino in sympathy with YAMAZAKI's demands and established "Japan Cinema Studio" (Narabigaoka Studio), a studio for rent in Narabigaoka, Kyoto.
Inspired by YAMAZAKI, Makino's chief stagehand Hiroshi KAWAI and cameraman Juzo TANAKA also left Makino and established the rentable "Japan Cinema Studio" (Narabigaoka Studio) in Narabigaoka, Kyoto.
sen.cmt: Hiroshi KAWAI, chief stage setting engineer of Makino > Makino's chief stagehand Hiroshi KAWAI; in sympathy with YAMAZAKI's demands > Inspired by YAMAZAKI; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Inspired by YAMAZAKI, Makino's chief stagehand Hiroshi KAWAI and cameraman Juzo TANAKA also left Makino and established the rentable studio 'Japan Cinema Studio' (Narabigaoka Studio) in Narabigaoka, Kyoto.

sen.j: 千恵プロ以下それぞれの設立したプロダクションが集まって「日本映画プロダクション連盟」を結成し、この河合・田中の「双ヶ丘撮影所」をレンタル使用して、「館主連盟」に作品の供給を開始する。
sen.e: Productions separately established as stated above, including Chie Pro, gathered together and formed "Japan Movie Production Federation" and they started to supply "Kanshu Renmei" with movies which were shot with the use of the rental "Narabigaoka Studio" operated by KAWAI and TANAKA.

All of the separately established production companies, including Chie Pro, came together to form "Japan Movie Production Federation" and began supplying films to "Kanshu Renmei" (the Theater Owner's Association) which were shot while using the "Narabigaoka Studio" operated by KAWAI and TANAKA.
sen.cmt: added description for "Kanshu Renmei"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: All of the separately established production companies, including Chie Pro, came together to form 'Japan Movie Production Federation' and began supplying films to 'Kanshu Renmei' (the Theater Owner's Association) which were shot while using the 'Narabigaoka Studio' operated by KAWAI and TANAKA.
sen.cmt: " "を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: 設立第1作は、行友李風の新国劇ヒットナンバー『月形半平太』を「双ヶ丘撮影所」で製作、監督には山口がマキノで主演した『仇討殉情録』の脚本を書いた印南弘をマキノから引き抜き、撮影技師には東亜キネマ京都撮影所の大塚周一を起用、共演には「市川小文治歌舞伎映画プロダクション」（歌舞伎映画プロ）を立ち上げた市川小文治、奈良の市川右太衛門プロダクションあやめ池撮影所（右太プロ）から来て小文治の「歌舞伎映画プロ」の第1作『野崎村』に出演した市川芳之助（のちの沢田清）、マキノから引き抜いた藤井民次、東亜キネマ京都撮影所から引き抜いた高田篤と都さくら、衣笠映画連盟からマキノに出演した千代田綾子、阪東妻三郎プロダクション太秦撮影所に映画に出演していた一色勝代を起用した。
sen.e: As its first movie Yamaguchi Pro picturized "Hanpeita TSUKIGATA," the hit shinkoku-geki (realistic period-drama) written by Rifu YUKITOMO, in "Narabigaoka Studio," recruiting Hiroshi INNAN, who had written the screenplay of "Adauchi junjo roku" in which YAMAGUCHI had starred while he was with Makino, away from Makino and appointing him as director, choosing Shuichi OTSUKA of Toa Kinema Kyoto Studio as a cameraman, and costarring Kobunji ICHIKAWA, who had set up "Ichikawa Kobunji Kabuki Eiga Production"(Kabuki Eiga Pro), Yoshinosuke ICHIKAWA (later known as Kiyoshi SAWADA), who had come from the Ayameike Studio of Ichikawa Utakemon Production (Uta Pro) in Nara and acted in "Nozaki-mura village," the first movie produced by Kobunji's "Kabuki Eiga Pro," Tamiji FUJII, who had been recruited away from Makino, Atsushi TAKADA and Sakura MIYAKO, who had been recruited away from Toa Kinema Kyoto Studio, Ayako CHIYODA, who acted for Makino while belonging to Kinugasa Eiga Renmei, and Katsuyo ISSHIKI, who had acted in movies in the Uzumasa movie studio of Bando Tsumasaburo Production.

For the first film, Yamaguchi Pro shot "Hanpeita TSUKIGATA," the hit shinkoku-geki (realistic period-drama) written by Rifu YUKITOMO, at "Narabigaoka Studio" by recruiting Makino's Hiroshi INNAN, who had written the screenplay of "Adauchi Junjo Roku" starring YAMAGUCHI, and appointed him as director; Shuichi OTSUKA of Toa Kinema Kyoto Studio was selected as cameraman; costars included Kobunji ICHIKAWA, who had set up "Ichikawa Kobunji Kabuki Eiga Productions" (Kabuki Eiga Pro); Yoshinosuke ICHIKAWA (later known as Kiyoshi SAWADA), who had come from Ichikawa Utakemon Productions' (Uta Pro) Ayameike Studio in Nara and acted in "Nozaki-mura village," the first movie produced by Kobunji's "Kabuki Eiga Pro"; Tamiji FUJII, who had been recruited away from Makino; Atsushi TAKADA and Sakura MIYAKO, who had been recruited away from Toa Kinema Kyoto Studio; Ayako CHIYODA, who acted for Makino while belonging to Kinugasa Eiga Renmei; and Katsuyo ISSHIKI, who had acted in films in Bando Tsumasaburo Productions' Uzumasa movie studio.

sen.j: 同作は「館主連盟」の配給で、同年7月19日に神戸新開地「菊水館」を中心に公開されたが、7月末に早くも山崎らの「館主連盟」が瓦解してしまった。
sen.e: This movie was distributed by "Kanshu Renmei" and released in theaters including "Kikusuikan" in Shinkaichi, Kobe on July 19, 1928, but YAMAZAKI's "Kanshu Renmei" fell apart as early as the end of July.
Although the film was distributed by "Kanshu Renmei" and released in theaters such as the "Kikusuikan" in Shinkaichi, Kobe on July 19, 1928, YAMAZAKI's "Kanshu Renmei" fell apart only days later.

sen.j: したがって、同時に独立したプロダクションたちとともに、2作目を製作することなく山口プロも解散した。
sen.e: As a result, Yamaguchi Pro was dissolved without producing the second movie, along with other productions which had been established at the same time.
As a result, Yamaguchi Pro was dissolved without producing a second movie along with other production companies that had been established at the same time.

sen.j: 解散後の山口は舞台に戻り、監督の印南、女優の小島は東亜キネマ京都撮影所へ、大塚は中根龍太郎喜劇プロダクションの『おんぼろ草紙』の撮影ののちにマキノに移籍、小文治と芳之助は千恵プロへ、高田は松竹京都撮影所へ、都は右太プロへ、千代田はツキガタプロダクション（月形龍之介）を経て東京の河合映画製作社へとそれぞれ移籍した。
sen.e: After the dissolution, YAMAGUCHI went back to the stage, INNAN the director and KOJIMA, an actress, moved to Toa Kinema Kyoto Studio, OTSUKA moved to Makino after shooting "Onboro Zoshi" for Nakane Ryutaro Comedy Production, Kobunji and Yoshinosuke moved to Chie Pro, TAKADA to Shochiku Kyoto Studio, MIYAKO to Uta Pro, and CHIYODA to Tsukigata Production (Ryunosuke TSUKIGATA) and then to Kawai eiga seisakusha in Tokyo.
